intro: Tieghemopanax pancheri, commonly known as the Pancheri's sycogath, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant has a distinctive trunk with a smooth, pale bark and produces edible fruits that are consumed by various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
